item.title: Household waste in black bin bags have been dumped there today on Winns Common Road by the Barriers,, 4th February
item.description:
Aload of household waste has been dumped by the barriers on the grass on winns common road, it has personal letters with personal information on i.e names and addresses and the vehicle registration on. I have photos of the pile of rubbish and the personal letters with the name and address on.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Heath Villas, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nw3 1dl, 4th February
item.description:

item.title: This dangerous wall on a public pedestrian ramp has still not been made safe., 4th February
item.description:
I reported this on 16 December. Nothing has been done. It is getting more and more dangerous. Other parts of this wall are also losing their cement and more and more structure is failing. This is a serious danger to the public. If this wall is not repaired it will also result in the private car park users being endangered from above.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown brambles and litter stuck in it, 4th February
item.description:
This corner has overgrown brambles and plants with loads of litter stuck under. I tried to remove the litter but the brambles need cutting before being able to remove the litter. Please send a team to cut overgrown green and remove the litter everywhere there. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Environmental crimes- Major fly tipping disaster, 4th February
item.description:
Major fly tipping disaster Really disappointing to see that this area has become a dumping ground. Lots of rats running around due to large piles of rubbish. Fire hazard. We need to get environmental services involved here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mount Pleasant Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The elm tree is getting very large again, 4th February
item.description:
This tree is supposed to be pruned regularly to prevent it damaging adjacent properties. It has not been pruned for several years and is getting oversized. In addition, the size is such that our gutters were totally filled with leaves from it in the autumn.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
